title: Minuteman Missile National Historic Site: Education
body: Teaching Stories of the Cold War and Nuclear Deterrence Mission, Duty and Vigilance are all values that can be learned by studying the experiences of the men and women who served in Minuteman Missile fields. For landowners and local citizens of the Great Plains, the Cold War had a defining effect upon their way of life for decades on end. The park offers Field Trips, Guest Speakers and Curriculum Materials to connect students to this nationally significant history.                 Ranger In Your Classroom Western South Dakota schools have the opportunity for a ranger to visit their classroom and present a program on the Cold War and nuclear deterrence Read More        Plan A Field Trip Learn how to schedule a field trip to visit Launch Control Facility Delta-01 and Launch Facility (Missile Silo) Delta-09 Read More        Minuteman Missile: A Legacy of the Cold War This Teaching With Historic Places Lesson Plan helps students learn about the missile gap and the coming of Minuteman Missiles to the Great Plains Read More        Distance Learning Schedule a long distance classroom session inside the underground Launch Control Center at Delta-01 Read More
